intro: Crepis kusnezovii, commonly known as the Kusnezov's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Crepis kusnezovii is known for its hardy nature and ability to survive in harsh climatic conditions.
